Header: Minister Mervyn should have sent his marriage proposal to Kandy Police says JVP
Content: Addressing a media conference held in Colombo this morning JVP General Secretary Tylvin Silva said that several particular factors should not have been included in the report to be prepared by UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Navi Pillay on Sri Lanka. Although the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has left the country after her fact finding mission, various opinions are sill expressed on her Sri Lanka visit. Followings are such expressions made by Ministers Patalee Champika Ranawaka, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Navaneedan Pillay, Ministers Keheliya Rambukwella, Mervyn Silva and JVP General Secretary Tylvin Silva.
